metadata.title: CVE-2021-0941 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In bpf_skb_change_head of filter.c, there is a possible out of bounds readdue to a use after free. This could lead to local escalation of privilegewith System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed forexploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID:A-154177719References: Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-0941` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1022-dell300x - 4.15.0-1022.26
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1044-gke - 5.4.0-1044.46~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1016-gkeop - 5.4.0-1016.17~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1086-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1086.91
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1103-snapdragon - 4.15.0-1103.112
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1010-ibm - 5.4.0-1010.11~18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-144.148').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '5.4.0-74.83~18.04.1').
